input: URGENT - Our Stripe payment integration is returning errors for 100% of transactions. Customers cannot complete purchases. The checkout page shows a generic error after clicking 'Pay Now'. This started at 2:14 PM UTC. We are losing approximately $3,000 per minute in sales. Our engineering team has confirmed the Stripe API keys are valid and the webhook endpoint is reachable. No recent deployments. Reported by on-call engineer Sam Rivera.

All users are unable to log into the platform. The login page returns a 500 Internal Server Error immediately after submitting credentials. New signups are also failing. This has been ongoing for 23 minutes. The auth service health check endpoint is returning HTTP 503. Our status page shows all systems operational (needs to be updated). Approximately 85,000 registered users are affected. DevOps engineer Priya Nair is investigating.

SECURITY ALERT: We have detected unauthorized access to our S3 bucket containing user profile data. The bucket was publicly accessible for approximately 6 hours due to a misconfigured IAM policy deployed this morning. The exposed data includes usernames, email addresses, and hashed passwords for approximately 15,000 users. No payment card data was exposed. The bucket has been locked down. Security engineer Danielle Park is leading the response.

Our checkout flow is failing for mobile users on iOS 17.4+. Approximately 28% of our traffic comes from iOS devices, and roughly 60% of those have updated to 17.4 or above. This means around 17% of all checkout attempts are failing with a JavaScript error in the payment form. Android and desktop are unaffected. The issue started after our frontend deploy at 10:30 AM UTC. Engineer Kenji Yamamoto has identified it as a Safari WebKit incompatibility with our payment tokenization library.

Our transactional email service (SendGrid) is dropping approximately 35% of emails including order confirmations, password reset links, and shipping notifications. The failure rate started at 8:00 AM UTC and appears to be caused by our account hitting SendGrid's reputation-based throttling after a bulk campaign sent last night inadvertently included unsubscribed addresses. Password reset emails are affected, meaning some users cannot recover account access. Backend engineer Aisha Johnson is coordinating with SendGrid support.

Our public REST API is returning 429 Too Many Requests for approximately 25% of partner API integrations. This is due to a rate limit configuration change deployed yesterday that incorrectly lowered the per-key rate limit from 500 req/min to 50 req/min for a subset of API key tiers. Affected partners include several high-volume integrations that process time-sensitive inventory sync. The misconfiguration affects 14 out of 56 active API key tiers. Platform engineer Marcus Chen identified the issue this morning.

Product search is returning empty results for queries containing special characters (apostrophes, ampersands, hyphens). This affects searches for product names like "O'Brien", "B&G Foods", and "Multi-Tool". Full-text search for normal alphanumeric queries works correctly. The Elasticsearch index was reindexed last week and the character escaping logic appears to have been broken during that process. Approximately 18% of product catalog searches are affected. QA engineer Rita Flores reported the issue.

The iOS app (version 5.1.2) crashes immediately when users attempt to access the 'Order History' screen if they have more than 200 past orders. Users with fewer than 200 orders are unaffected. The crash occurs due to an unhandled memory allocation failure when loading the full order list without pagination. Approximately 3% of our iOS user base has 200+ orders (mainly power users and small business accounts). Mobile developer Hana Watanabe reproduced the crash and identified the root cause.

The advanced reporting module (used exclusively by admin users with the 'Analytics' permission role) is showing incorrect percentage calculations in the 'Conversion Funnel' report. The percentages appear to be calculated based on total site visitors rather than unique visitors, inflating the funnel drop-off rates. The underlying data is correct -- only the percentage display logic is wrong. Approximately 45 admin users have access to this report. Data analyst Victor Osei noticed the discrepancy during a weekly review.

On the account settings page, the 'Update Password' and 'Update Email' buttons are overlapping each other on viewport widths between 960px and 1024px (common for tablet landscape view). Both buttons remain fully functional and clickable. The overlap is purely cosmetic -- the button labels become unreadable. The issue was introduced in a CSS grid refactor three days ago. No functional impact. Affects an estimated 2% of sessions based on viewport analytics. UI developer Chen Wei reported the issue.

The product detail page tooltip that appears when hovering over the 'Add to Wishlist' heart icon incorrectly says 'Add to Cart' instead of 'Add to Wishlist'. The tooltip appears on all product pages. The actual add-to-wishlist functionality works correctly when clicked -- only the tooltip label is wrong. This is a copy/paste error from a recent tooltip library update. No user actions are affected. Content editor Jordan Blake filed the ticket after a user reported confusion.

Payment processing is failing for 7% of checkout attempts. The failures appear to be concentrated among users who saved payment methods more than 90 days ago, suggesting a token expiry issue with our payment vault. Affected users can complete purchases by re-entering their card details. The payment team is investigating whether to proactively refresh tokens or prompt affected users to update their stored cards. Reported by customer support lead Brendan Shaw after a spike in 'payment declined' complaints.

The password reset flow is broken for users who registered using Google OAuth and later added a password to their account (approximately 340 users). These users receive the password reset email but clicking the link results in a 'token not found' error. Standard (non-OAuth) users and pure OAuth users (no password set) are unaffected. The bug was introduced last week during a session management refactor. Engineer Leila Hassan identified the affected cohort through database analysis.

Our webhook delivery system is failing to deliver events to approximately 8% of registered webhook endpoints. The affected endpoints are those using TLS 1.0 or 1.1, which we recently deprecated. The integration partners who rely on these endpoints are not receiving order status updates, inventory sync events, or payment notifications. Partners can resolve this by upgrading their TLS configuration, but most have not yet done so. Platform engineer Omar Reyes identified the pattern.

ESCALATING INCIDENT: Started at 9:05 AM as a P2 -- our CDN (Cloudflare) was serving stale product images for approximately 12% of product listings following a cache invalidation failure. However, at 9:47 AM our monitoring detected that the CDN issue has cascaded: Cloudflare is now returning 502 errors for ALL image assets across the entire site. All product images, user avatars, and static assets are broken. This is now affecting 100% of users and the site appears visually broken. DevOps lead Angela Torres is managing the incident escalation.
